Hello all,

I have Heritrix crawling many sites with individual crawl jobs per 
domain. These are Domain scoped and currently focus on HTML only. I 
am writing mirrors of the domains. I have another application which 
is charged with archiving the mirror(when the crawl job is finished) 
and moving it to another system for knowledge extraction, taxonomic 
classification and ontology manifestation.I am just looking for 
someone to point me in the rite direction. I would like to have 
Heritrix add a line to a text file to signify the job is complete and 
ready for archiving, transportation, and digestion by another 
application.

I assume I should just be able to extend whatever class handles the 
end crawl job cleanup to accomplish the above without messing any 
internals up. I am trying to keep the Crawler completley independant 
from other components other than gathering the output in file format.

On a side note I have herd a rumor that only one instance of Heritrix 
can be run per server. Is this true. It sounds like I could isolate 
two instances fairly easily. Is the issue with the IP, IE: can only 
one instance of Heritrix run on one IP?

By the way the last help I got from this list was great! I am also 
still interested in helping with development. I may soon have a R&D 
department that will most likely be focusing some energy on Heritrix. 
Personally, I am a friend of open souce so mabey we can get some 
comercial bucks into the OS process and make everyone smile.

Thank you in advance. Any help is always greatly apreciated
Brian M. Lima
